  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dunnage was around a pallet that arrived to 075 and it was discovered that a piece of the dunnage had 3 nails which punctured the side of a box containing jugs of corrosive causing a slow leak to one of the jugs. The operations supervisor advised most of the spill was contained to the box but the bottom of the box is wet and there is a small amount on the dock floor just outside the door of the trailer. Safety advised CURA would be contacted for remediation.

  • Description: GATX22086 had a release of product after making contact with another car during normal humping operations. Car was not an overspeed and was within limits of coupling speed. Frangible disc and cap securing disc was blown off the car and found on the ground approx. 10 ft from car. Disc had the middle blown out and cap did have some threads damaged when located. It appears the cap was not secured on the car which caused the cap to come off car.

item.title: Report E-2025040229
item.description:
Report E-2025040229

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-09T12:25:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-07
  • City: CONROE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10500
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On April 7, 2025, at 1847, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar Inway personnel in Conroe, TX regarding the release of FLP MC-130 Conc. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 330 gallons of FLP MC-130 Conc. (UN1993, 3, III) from (1) 330-gallon poly tote onto the trailer floor and soil. The release was reportedly due to a load shift during transit, impacting the trailer floor and a 30’ x 50’ area of soil surrounding the trailer. No drains or waterways were impacted by the release. The trailer floor was cleaned up with absorbents and the proper PPE. The top layer of impacted soil was removed, then the harder layer underneath was secured for future excavation. 200 gallons of product were recovered from the ground and placed in a tote for potential recycling. The impacted absorbents and removed soil were containerized in (1) roll-off container which was taken offsite by the contractor for proper disposal along with the empty 330-gallon tote and recovered 200 gallons of product.

  • City: HOUSTON

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0700 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a 3-cup release of UN1155, Ethyl Ether Anhydrous from at least 3 5-gallon metal pails due to a puncture caused by improper loading (heavier freight crushed pails) from terminal LSX. The spill was contained to the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and she felt confident cleaning the release, confirmed adequate ventilation on the trailer to properly clean the spill with absorbent, and will containerize waste into a 30-gallon DM. Per the BoL, Chemtrec was notified and provided report #2025031100038.

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-07T21:14:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-09
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L TRANSFER, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 9, 2025, two (2) 22-liter jugs of Rhino Brite were damaged in transit and released approximately 1.5-gallons of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carrier retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Safety and Health Consulting Services (ES&H) to remediate the site. ES&H personnel deployed absorbents to the impacted dock and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged jugs of product were placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum.

  • Description: Chris Lawrence, Operations Supervisor, called Safety to report a smell coming from a 5-gallon tank of UN3336, Mercaptan mixture, liquid, flammable, n.o.s, 3, PGll, sitting on the dock in bay 11. Chris stated that the tank did not appear to be damaged in any way, but there was a noticeable smell comi ng from it. Safety contacted CURA and spoke with Lander Allgood, who advised that to be safe, he would send a team out to check the tank. Safety informed Chris that CURA had been called to assist with the tank.

  • Description: On April 4th, 2025, while loading and unloading a shipment of liquid drums at Veolia's 10-day in-transit facility, a Veolia employee picked up a drum of petroleum distillates using the drum gripper to weigh it. During this process, a co-worker noticed a small pinhole leak in the drum. The employees promptly covered the hole with a spill pad and tape to stop the leak, then cleaned up the spilled liquid on the floor using spill dry. The leaking drum was overpacked into a 951H2 container for continued transportation.

item.title: Report E-2025040107
item.description:
Report E-2025040107

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-04
  • City: GARLAND
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 14500
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a punctured leaking poly tote containing hazardous product, Barquat MB-50. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 140-gallon release onto the wooden trailer floor, the concrete beneath the trailer, the asphalt parking lot, and the soil. The trailer floor was impacted in a 20’ x 8.5’ area and the concrete beneath the trailer, asphalt, and soil were impacted in a 100’ x 75’ area. The contractor neutralized the release and applied oil dry. A vac truck extracted approximately 2,700-gallons of impacted rainwater and containerized it into one vac box. Three 55-gallon DF’s containing the cut-up tote, impacted oil dry, and impacted PPE were also generated. ERTS will coordinate disposal of the vac box. XPO will manage the drum waste created from the response. No storm-drains or waterways were involved in this incident.
